meanings.definition: The state or quality of lacking courage or confidence.
meanings.sent1: Her nervelessness prevented her from speaking up in class.
meanings.sent2: His nervelessness made it difficult for him to try new things.
meanings.sent3: Despite her nervelessness, she managed to give a speech at the event.
meanings.sent4: His nervelessness in the face of danger was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The nervelessness she displayed during the interview was admirable.

meanings.definition: The inability to feel or show emotion.
meanings.sent1: The actor's nervelessness on stage surprised the audience.
meanings.sent2: Her nervelessness during sad movies always amazed her friends.
meanings.sent3: His nervelessness in emotional situations sometimes led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: The patient's nervelessness worried the doctor.
meanings.sent5: The nervelessness in his voice hinted at a deeper struggle.

meanings.definition: The absence of nerves or nervousness.
meanings.sent1: The athlete's nervelessness before the big game was inspiring.
meanings.sent2: His nervelessness in high-pressure situations was enviable.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's nervelessness on stage kept the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: The pilot's nervelessness during turbulence reassured the passengers.
meanings.sent5: The nervelessness of the surgeon calmed the worried family.
